author: ogenev
content: <@!510413979080720385> JFYI, what you are proposing is currently implemented in Trin. We use the `protocol` parameter in discv5 `talk_req`  to distinguish between the different networks.

author: deme1744
content:
Great, and yes, it is what I expect that clients would do in order to reuse the wire protocol code and avoid duplication, the suggestion is nothing special :). By also separating it in the spec, we would be sure that the wire protocols remain the same (they currently aren't between state and chain history).
This is why I'd suggest we start from this, as it is simple, and when necessary we can reassess if further abstractions/subprotocols/specific payloads/etc. are needed.

author: deme1744
content: Fluffy is a Portal client in development, just like Trin, but written in the Nim language. Code is under our nimbus-eth1 repository: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth1/tree/master/fluffy

author: deme1744
content: See also our (older) introduction post: https://our.status.im/nimbus-fluffly/
